intro: Anacheilium chimborazoense, commonly known as the Chimborazo anacheilium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features include a sympodial growth habit and specialized roots adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Anacheilium chimborazoense is also noted for its ecological significance in its native habitat.
